text: Really sweet romcom with all-star cast. Matthew McConaughey was great and I love the supporting cast. Not a deep plot but well acted and entertaining.
Not believable at all and the match McConaughey/Parker does not work for me.
Classic y2k romcom! Cheesy and funny, the movie fulfills what it proposes

OK, the joke is obvious - this movie failed to launch, though it was pleasant most of the time. In fact, it was just a minor romcom with major actors a bit before their prime (Matthew McConnaughey, Bradley Cooper) and little chemistry between the romantic pairs, especially Matthew and Sarah Jessica Parker. Brazilians will understand: it was a bit like a Globo movie - nice-looking people and very little depth. And I really didn't understand what exactly the consultant Sarah was trying to achieve or how to get the guy to leave his parents' home.
So dumb I couldn't get through the first 5 minutes.
Wish to same thing happen to meee hha, very good rom-com

Neither a romance nor a comedy - EXCEPT for brief, breathless seconds of joy with Zooey Deschanel. This thing is so excruciating, you gotta wonder how these actors' careers even survived. How many date nights went limp after after this torture of cliches? The acting's fine, but the writing drags it all down like shoes of concrete.

A simply OK film, though the last 20/30 minutes or so does drag a tad.

Matthew McConaughey is good, Sarah Jessica Parker is good, the support cast (which includes an early role of Bradley Cooper's) are good. I didn't overly enjoy what I was watching, but I wasn't particularly bored with it either. I don't really have much to say about it in truth.

At around 90 minutes, it doesn't overstay its welcome. That makes it a watchable, if slightly forgettable, flick from 2006 in my books.
A fun romantic comedy.
Unfunny cliché and with gender images of the last generation. More of an experience that beloved actors are only as good as the screenplay... Please don't
To be or not to be, bachelor!
The cast does enough to at least make some of the film enjoyable.

Failure To launch 🚀- plug.

Matt isn't as obnoxious as usual here, but the time line is rather rushed with an abrupt resolve. A few moments here and there but relies on a couple gags too much. Why are animals constantly attacking?
A cute story with decent galpal / bromance side characters that's entertaining if you don't expect it to be too deep.
Very solid Matthew McConaughey chick flick bc sometimes that's just what you need. Good movie? I dunno about that

This romcom has a good theme, it's really well made and Matthew McConaughey is great as always. The one questionable decision is the casting of Sarah Jessica Parker as the female lead. She simply looks too old to be a good match for Matthew McConaughey. Nothing wrong with her acting, but the physical attraction has to be believable somehow.
Zooey and McConaughey are such charming actors it is hard to hate it even if the script is weak.

Failure to Launch (2006) continues to sit at the forefront of the rom-com genre over a decade later, thanks to a unique, if unbelievable concept and a solid casting effort from top to bottom, despite a lackluster script.

The movie stars Matthew McConaughey as a 35-year-old who still lives with his parents, and Sarah Jessica Parker as a woman hired by his parents to date him and get him to move out. 

In addition to its two co-stars, Failure to Launch features a remarkable ensemble cast of supporting characters, including Zooey Deschanel, Bradley Cooper, Justin Bartha, Terry Bradshaw, and Kathy Bates. It also happens that most of those actors are wasted in their roles, but the movie definitely benefits from them.

Failure to Launch won't break your heart. While it has its human moments, including a twist on why McConaughey won't move out, it doesn't carry much weight scene-to-scene. Additionally, it's only average in its humor, and a lot of it is quite cheesy, particularly our protagonist's frequent animal assaults.

Despite only being an average film, it has that "it factor" that makes it enjoyable over multiple viewings, even if it won't make anyone's favorites list. I give it 4 out of 5 stars for "creative and unique situations, funny if comedy, high quality, but not iconic or exceptional."

I wanted to put on a movie in the background but this was so bad I couldn't even let it exist in my home. There's no stakes, the roommate character is INSANE, the story is also insane, etc. The story "takes place" in Baltimore but they go surfing with dolphins????????? Put on literally anything else. LOL to that there are two Oscar winners in this.
